file_content.text: We made it! Take me to Jonas, I'll fill you in on what I learned.
Run for it!
Timer's set--she's ready to blow!
Go, go, go!
Let's move out!
Just how far away do we need to be when this thing goes off?
What's the blast radius?
No clue. I say we just start running.
I hope you're better with explosives than you are at staying undercover.
This better work.
Feel free to stick around here and find out. Me? I'm going to run.
Keep them off me!
Ah, that felt good. You don't know how many times I had to talk myself out of murdering that walking scum....
More Imps could be on the way--let's get you back to safety.
We need to move out.
You're right--the "rescue team" will be here any second now. But we can't leave yet.
Watching everything the Imps do and not interfering? That's tough.
Being undercover must be hard.
You learn to take the little victories where you can.
You should have stayed inconspicuous until I cleared the area.
That was a pretty dumb move.
You had the situation in hand. If you'd worked for the guy, you'd have wanted to shoot him in the back, too--trust me.
An Imperial rescue team'll be here any second, so let's move.
I need to rig the ship to blow--that should vape all of the evidence of my little disappearing act. Can you cover me?
Get to work. I'll keep you safe.
Affirmative.
Much obliged.
Havoc Squad, remember?
I'll just get to work, then.
General Garza probably wouldn't like it if I left you to die.
It's not like I have a choice.
Probably not. I'm sure the phrase "failure is not an option" came up more than once on this op.
I'll get to work. Shouldn't take long.
